title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.15 | 06-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: So, it's a festive atmosphere just because Krishna has arrived in Dwaraka.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam describing the festive reception of Krishna in Dwaraka, emphasizing the auspicious decorations and atmosphere.

segments.key_quote: Without distribution of food no function is complete and that is the way of Vedic tradition
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Srila Prabhupada's teachings about the importance of worshiping the Lord with requisite ingredients and distributing the remnants (prasadam) as an essential part of Vedic culture.

segments.key_quote: If they eat food which is not offered to Krishna, then they are eating sin.
segments.summary: The speaker quotes Bhagavad Gita to explain that eating food not offered to Krishna leads to sinful reactions, emphasizing the importance of offering food as a sacrifice.

segments.key_quote: So when we are to offer food, we should remember, we should offer food only that is in the mode of goodness.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that taking birth in the material world is due to past sinful activities and that we should offer food in the mode of goodness to Krishna.
The speaker discusses the importance of performing sacrifices in the mode of goodness and emphasizes the significance of prasadam distribution in temples, following Srila Prabhupada's instructions.

segments.key_quote: Prasadam distribution is also important in Kali Yuga because people can purify their heart of sinful reactions simply by taking Prasadam, Krishna Prasadam.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by highlighting the benefits of prasadam distribution in Kali Yuga, emphasizing its ability to purify the heart, awaken devotion, and facilitate spiritual advancement, ending with a Hare Krishna.
